original_title: ‘CID officer sought a bribe of Rs. 130 Mn’ – Alleges Criminal held at CID
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lankan authorities have launched an investigation into an incident where an officer of the country's Criminal Investigations Department has reportedly requested a bribe from an underworld criminal detained at the CID.

The officer in question had reportedly sought a bribe of Rs. 130 Million from a criminal identified as 'Kudu Salindu' (Real name: Salindu Malshika) who is currently being detailed at the CID premises.
The revelation was made when Fort Magistrate Thilina Gamage visited the CID premises in Colombo on Wednesday (26) to monitor the suspect.

The suspect 'Kudu Salindu' (Real name: Salindu Malshika) had informed the Magistrate that a CID officer sought a bribe from him, and that he informed about it to the OIC at the CID on the 31st of May.
Fort Magistrate Thilina Gamage had ordered the Inspector General of Police to immediately investigate the claim and submit a report.

'Kudu Salindu' (Real name: Salindu Malshika) is currently being held by the CID along with another drug trafficker and underworld criminal identified as 'Harak Kata' (Real name: Nadun Chinthaka Wickramaratne).
They were arrested together in Madagascar and were deported to Sri Lanka on the 15th of March 2023.
They are held at the Criminal Investigations Department for further investigations under detention orders.
